docs.snippet: DIVERSE facets of modernism were furnished to the week's exhibitions in New York galleries by Picasso and Miro of the Europeans and by two South American artists -- Lasar Segall of Brazil and Antonio Frasconi of Uruguay.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 21 -- The first formal suggestion that Argentina needs a dollar loan to bridge the period until the expected Marshall Plan funds begin to flow here, has just been made in a study by the Argentine section of the Inter-American...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 21 -- The first formal suggestion that Argentina needs a dollar loan to bridge the period until the expected Marshall Plan funds begin to flow here, has just been made in a study by the Argentine section of the Inter-American Council of Commerce and Production.

docs.snippet: Arnold S. Denker of New York won his second game in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, defeating Mariano Castillo, champion of Chile, after forty-two moves in the eighth round, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arnold S. Denker of New York won his second game in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, defeating Mariano Castillo, champion of Chile, after forty-two moves in the eighth round, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: DENKER ADVANCES IN MASTERS CHESS; Beats Chile's Castillo After 42 Moves for Third Place in Argentine Tourney

docs.snippet: It was a quiet week in the foreign exchanges, in which the only special movement noted was that in the pound sterling which on Thursday was struck by a sizable foreign selling order causing an immediate slump to $4.03. At this point fresh buying...
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a quiet week in the foreign exchanges, in which the only special movement noted was that in the pound sterling which on Thursday was struck by a sizable foreign selling order causing an immediate slump to $4.03. At this point fresh buying asserted itself and the rate was retraced to a close on Friday of $4.03 1/4, unchanged from the preceding week.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, March 22 -- Argentina announced today that she would not join the International Trade Organization, whose formation has been agreed to by an overwhelming majority of the delegations to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, March 22 -- Argentina announced today that she would not join the International Trade Organization, whose formation has been agreed to by an overwhelming majority of the delegations to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment.
docs.abstract: Govt announces plans to shun ITO, Havana conf

headline.main: ARGENTINA SHUNS WORLD TRADE UNIT; Announces She Will Not Join ITO -- Large Majority Favors Charter in Final Draft

headline.main: ELISKASES CHESS LEADER; Austrian Victor Over Olivera -Denker Loses in Argentina

docs.snippet: With a brilliant victory over Gideon Stahlberg of Sweden in the tenth round, Erich Eliskases of Austria took a firm grip on first place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: With a brilliant victory over Gideon Stahlberg of Sweden in the tenth round, Erich Eliskases of Austria took a firm grip on first place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: ELISKASES CHESS VICTOR; Stahlberg Loses to Austrian in Argentina Denker Bows

docs.snippet: Erich Eliskases of Austria gained his seventh victory in the eleventh round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina. He defeated Paul Michel of Germany, who had been undefeated in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Erich Eliskases of Austria gained his seventh victory in the eleventh round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina. He defeated Paul Michel of Germany, who had been undefeated in nine rounds, but lost in the tenth.

docs.snippet: Erich Eliskases of Austria and Antonio Medina of Spain, first and second, respectively, in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, retained their relative positions at the end of the twelfth round yesterday, according to a report...
docs.lead_paragraph: Erich Eliskases of Austria and Antonio Medina of Spain, first and second, respectively, in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata, retained their relative positions at the end of the twelfth round yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: ELISKASES BEATS DENKER; American Suffers Fourth Defeat in Argentine Chess
